bhtAttempts.bht: When faced with the false doctrines and regulatory interference from Jerusalem, Paul and Barnabas were not willing to watch the Gentile church in Antioch be mistreated and labeled as heretics. The church recognized Paul and Barnabas as their leaders, and it was only natural for them to formally dispatch a delegation to consult the church in Jerusalem, which could be considered the mother church of Gentile Christianity. This way, the deadlock between the Judaizers and Paul and Barnabas could be resolved, and the truth could be established. The Divine voice seemed to come to Paul at this critical moment, instructing him to propose the mission to Jerusalem. Indeed, it was important to oppose the Jewish impositions and consult all the apostles to ensure a unified decision.
